title: Love-themed gate restyle, Final page readability fixes, and smaller YES button

requirements.summary: Make the Final page message and signature solid pure white, remove shimmer animation, and preserve existing fonts and scroll/line-break behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: On /final, the long message is rendered in solid white (no shimmer/metallic/shine animation).
On /final, the signature “- YOUR ARSU” is rendered in solid white and retains its existing font family styling.
Page 3 remains vertically scrollable and preserves existing line breaks (whitespace-pre-wrap behavior remains intact).

file_operations.description: Remove the shimmer/shine styling from the long message (drop animate-shimmer) and render both the message and signature in solid pure white while keeping the existing font classes and whitespace-pre-wrap/scroll container behavior intact.

requirements.summary: Reduce the YES button size on the Proposal page without changing its romantic styling or navigation behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: On /proposal, the YES button is visibly smaller than before (reduced padding and/or font size), while retaining the same styling and hover/transition behavior.

file_operations.description: Add support for a smaller size option (e.g., via an optional prop or className override) that only adjusts sizing tokens (padding/font-size) while keeping the same colors, rounded shape, backdrop-blur, and hover/transition behavior.
Use the updated RomanticButton sizing API (or pass an override) so the YES button renders slightly smaller on /proposal while preserving the existing click handler that navigates to /final.

requirements.summary: Restyle the Enter Website gate with a Valentine/love theme and visible animated hearts on desktop and mobile while keeping the same enter-to-dismiss behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Before entering the site, the gate screen shows a love-themed visual style (romantic/love colors) rather than a plain black/white appearance.
The gate screen includes heart-themed animation(s) visible on both desktop and mobile.
Clicking/tapping “Enter the Website” still dismisses the gate and reveals the existing 3-page flow unchanged.

file_operations.description: Update the gate screen styling to a more Valentine/love-themed look (romantic gradients/overlays) and render decorative heart elements behind/around the content; keep the current state-driven gate behavior and Enter button click-to-dismiss unchanged.

Add heart-themed animation keyframes and utility classes used by EnterWebsiteGate (e.g., floating/drifting hearts, gentle pulsing), ensuring the hearts are visible on both desktop and mobile and do not affect the existing full-screen background rendering rules elsewhere.
